derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent. (denoting the act or process of delegating; also in the sense 'delegated power'): from Latin delegatio(n-), from delegare 'send on a commission' (see delegate)

entry.def: A delegation is a group of people who have been sent somewhere to have talks with other people on behalf of a larger group of people.

example.tran: 来自索马里兰的代表团

example.ex: He was sent to New York as part of the Dutch delegation to the United Nations.
example.tran: 他作为出席联合国会议的荷兰代表团成员被派往纽约。

means.word_mean: 1. a group of representatives or delegates
2. authorizing subordinates to make certain decisions
